Posts.Title: are 'suspicious' ultrasounds ever NOT cancer? scar3d2death Kareywith3littlekittens

Posts.Content: Nov 12, 2012 12:57PM scar3d2death wrote: The bump on your areola sounds like a cyst of some sort (I have had these with white dots too, after pregnancy) Try not to scare yourself silly about the lumps, I know it's hard! I'm in the same boat so can totally relate. Chances are it's a fibroadenoma (the kidney bean lump) but should be checked by a doctor. Call your local family planning center and tell them you have no insurance and found a lump. Most family planning centers have free breast screenings and *if* something is found, they can help you decide where to go from there with no insurance. I live in a fairly small town in the middle of nowhere and our family planning clinic does a ton of free breast stuff for woman with no insurance. ((hugs))
Posts.Title: New here and concerned MomToFive MomToFive

Posts.Content: Nov 13, 2012 07:30PM scar3d2death wrote: Did you try calling your family planning clinic? I know the one here has equiptment to screen the breasts and they do it for free or for minimal donation. I agree with the others - head to the ER. If you know you're going to qualify for medicaid, I believe they pay 30 or 60 days retroactive so you shouldn't have to worry about the bill.

My surgeon wanted to wait until after the baby was born (needless to say it was a long 9 months) Had a surgical biopsy - results B9!
